events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a roadside barrier on highway exit 23.
Based on the description, the claim was categorized under ‘Auto Accident’ to allow proper routing.
An insurance agent with expertise in auto claims was assigned to assist the customer promptly.
Customer received acknowledgement of claim receipt along with an estimated timeline for resolution.
The agent requested police report, vehicle registration, and photographs of the vehicle damage.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, police report, and repair estimates.
Investigator began review of submitted evidence and contacted local authorities to verify accident details.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer is not at fault and damage is consistent with the accident.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering full vehicle repair cost and rental reimbursement.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and quick handling of the case.
Management approved the claim settlement after final review of all documentation and internal validation.
The payment for the agreed settlement amount was issued directly to the repair shop as requested by the customer.
Claim was officially closed with no further actions needed after payment was successfully processed.
